Idiom (Tsonga): Ku wela ka tihomu ehenhla ka ndlopfu
Syntactic Structure & Grammatical Form: Fixed clause; verb phrase with locative preposition
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To face a great challenge or opponent far stronger than oneself
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Originates from Tsonga folktales symbolizing courage against overwhelming odds
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Tsonga): /ku ˈβɛla ka tiˈhomu ɛˈhɛnɬa ka nˈɮɔpfu/
First Example Sentence: Ndzi titwa onge ndzi wela ka tihomu ehenhla ka ndlopfu loko ndzi langutana ni ntirho lowu.
Second Example Sentence: A nga ha swi koti, hikuva ku wela ka tihomu ehenhla ka ndlopfu swa tika swinene.
Third Example Sentence: Loko u lwa na vusweti, i ku wela ka tihomu ehenhla ka ndlopfu.

Second Example Sentence: Ku fana ni ku lova hi ndlala, u ri ni tihomu ehandle ka muti.
Third Example Sentence: Ndzi n'wi byele leswaku ku lova hi ndlala, u ri ni tihomu, i vubihi bya ku nga anakanyi.
